description.en: A resource that acts or has the power to act.
A number of people organized into a community or other social, commercial, or political structure.
A natural person.
An organization that is legally registered
The registration is a fundamental relationship between a legal entity and the authority with which it is registered and that confers legal status upon it.
The legal name of the organisation.
Person whose information is recorded in a register.
The full name of the person, in a general a combination of the first and last name.
Identification code of the person in the register.
Consent of the DataSubject for the specified Processing of their PersonalData.

usage.en: REMARK: The name of this class does not imply that Consent has been given or is valid. This  depends on the value of attributes like hasConsentStatus and others.

description.en: TODO
Entity that is responsible for this stage of the Consent.

usage.en: Eg the Dat Controller if the status is ConsentRequested or the DataSubject for a ConsentGiven. To be updated when the ConsentStatus changes. REMARK: Required in case of Consent by delegation, such as in the case of a parent or a guardian responsible for providing or affirming Consent. Can be omitted if the referenced entity is identical to the DataSubject.

description.en: Moment when this stage of the Consent was created.

usage.en: To be updated when the ConsentStatus changes.

description.en: Reference to the applied or used ConsentNotice.
Location where this stage of the Consent was created.

usage.en: To be updated when the ConsentStatus changes.

description.en: Indicates information about the Duration of the Consent.

usage.en: For example to indicate how long the Consent is valid (eg 6 months), or until what time (eg 31 december 2022) or until which event (eg account closure).

description.en: Indicates the association of the Consent with a DataSubject.
Specifies the state or status of consent.

usage.en: Examples are: ConsentRequested, ConsentGiven, ConsentWithdrawn etc.

description.en: A Notice for information provision associated with a Consent.

usage.en: This is to inform the Data Subject before his Consent can be obtained. To be substituted by a String, URL or Document referencing the actual Notice.

description.en: The individual or organisation that decides (or controls) the purpose(s) of processing the PersonalData.

usage.en: The terms 'Controller' is usually the more common form of indicating a DataController. In ISO/IEC the term 'PII Controller' is used.

description.en: A 'processor' means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the DataController.
The individual (or category of individuals) whose PersonalData is being processed.

usage.en: The term 'data subject' is specific to the GDPR, but is functionally equivalent to the term 'individual' and the ISO/IEC term 'PII Principle'. REMARK: Can also be instantiated as a category, eg PersonalDataHandling123 for DataSubject(s) of type Customer.

description.en: Type of DataSubject.

usage.en: For example age-based types like Adult, Child or domain-based ones like Patient, Employee ore jurisdictional roles like Citizen, Immigrant.

description.en: A human or non-human 'thing' that constitutes as an entity.

usage.en: To be used as an abstract superclass and to be substituted by an Agent like a Person or Organisation and/or a LegalEntity like a DataSubject, DataController etc.

description.en: Indicates the relation between the Entity and a DataSubject.

usage.en: Typically used in case of Consent by delagation, ie to specify that the Entity that indicated the Consent is related to the DataSubject. The kind of relationship is implied by the types of DataSubject and Entity (typically Child and Parent/Guardian of DataSubject respectively).

description.en: The legal basis used to justify the Processing of the PersonalData.

usage.en: REMARK: This profile focusses on one kind of Legal Basis, namely Consent. REMARK: DPV provides the possiblity to use LegalBasis as a category, eg the LegalBasis of PersonalDataHandling123 is Consent.

description.en: Indicates the association with the PersonalDataHandling.
A human or non-human 'thing' that constitutes as an entity and which is recognised and defined in law.

usage.en: Superclass of entities like Data Subject, DataController etc, ie roles with legal importance in the GDPR.

description.en: Data directly or indirectly associated or related to an individual.

usage.en: This definition of personal data encompasses the concepts used in GDPR Art.4-1 for 'personal data' and ISO/IEC 2700 for 'personally identifiable information (PII)'.

description.en: TODO
Type of PersonalData.

usage.en: Examples from the DPV codelist are based on the source of the data (like Derived, Inferred, Observed) or on their sensitivity or other. REMARK: More thematic categories can be found in the DPV Extended Personal Data concepts codelist.

description.en: A high-level Class to describe 'data handling'. This can consist of PersonalData being processed for a Purpose, involving Entities, using TechnicalOrganisationalMeasures, applicable Risks, Rights, and LegalBasis.

usage.en: REMARK: DPV uses the term 'data handling' to distinguish between the general meaning of processing (eg collect PersonalData from DataSubject123 by DataController456 for the Purpose of marketing) versus the operations pereformed with the data (eg consult, share etc).

description.en: Indicates the use or applicability of a TechnicalOrganisationalMeasure.

usage.en: Refers to the type of the TechnicalOrganisationalMeasure that has been taken to protect the the PersonalData. Examples of TechnicalMeasures are Anonymisation, Encryption, WebSecurityProtocols. OrganisationalMeasures could be measures like ConsentNotices, Privacy Notices, CredentialManagement.

description.en: Indicates the applicability of a Risk associated with the PersonalDataHandling.
Indicates the use or applicability of a Right with the PersonalDataHandling.
Indicates the Recipient of the PersonalData.
Indicates the association with the Purpose.
Indicates the association with the Processing.
Indicates the association with the PersonalData.
Indicates the use or applicability of a LegalBasis.
Indicates the association with the DataSubject.
Indicates the inclusion or applicability of a Data Processor.
Indicates the association with the DataController.
The processing performed on the Personal Data.
Indicates information about the storage of the PersonalData.
Type of Processing.

usage.en: Refers to the kind of operation that is performed  on the PersonalData. Examples are Collect, Disclose, Share.

description.en: The purpose of processing the PersonalData.
Type of Purpose.

usage.en: Refers to the reason or justification for the PersonalDataHandling. Examples in the context of Consent are Marketing, Personalised Advertising, Commercial research.

description.en: Entitiy that receives the PersonalData.

usage.en: A Recipient of Personal Data can be used to indicate any Entity that receives the data. This can be a Third Party, Processor (GDPR), or even a Controller.

description.en: The right(s) applicable, provided, or expected.

usage.en: A 'right' is a legal, social, or ethical principle of freedom or entitlement which dictates the norms regarding what is allowed or owed. Rights as a concept encompass a broad area of norms and entities, and are not specific to individuals or Data Protection / Privacy. REMARK: For individual specific rights, see DPV:DataSubjectRight and EU Fundamental Rights.

description.en: A risk or possibility or uncertainty of negative effects, impacts, or consequences.

usage.en: Risks can be associated with one or more different concepts such as Purpose, Processing, PersonalData, TechnicalOrganisationalMeasures. REMARK: More info on this class in DPV-Risk.

description.en: Conditions required or followed regarding storage of data.

usage.en: When the type of Processing is 'store', subclasses of this abstract class allow to specify duration, location etc of the storage.

description.en: Duration or temporal limitation on the storage of the PersonalData.
Indicates information about the Duration of the storage.

usage.en: For example how long the data is stored (eg 6 months), or until what time (eg 31 december 2022) or until which event (eg account closure).

description.en: Information used to uniquely identify of an object.

usage.en: The basic principle here is that this string is assigned by an organisation and that this is done according to a well-defined system.

description.en: Name of the Agent that issued the identifier.
String used to uniquely identify the object.

usage.en: The type of the string refers to the identification system (including its version), the string itself refers to the actual identifier.

description.en: The date on which the identifier was issued.
Link to the Agent that issued the identifier.

A location can be an identifiable geographic place (ISO 19112), but it can also be a non-geographic place such as a directory, row, or column. As such, there are numerous ways in which location can be expressed, such as by a coordinate, address, landmark, and so forth.
The duration or temporal limitation.

usage.en: REMARK: The details of this class can be provided by using the Time Ontology according to the type of Duration. Eg if the type is DPV:TemporalDuration one could adda OWL-TIME:TemporalEntity as an additional type and hasXSDDuration as an attribute.

description.en: Type of Duration

usage.en: Examples are TemporalDuration (eg 6 months), UnitilTimeDuration (eg till 31 december 2022), UntilEventDuration (eg until account closure).
